channel.title: Programming on Mailund on the Internet
channel.description: Recent content in Programming on Mailund on the Internet

item.title: Lazy queues
item.description: The purpose of the lazy lists I implemented in my previous post was to build lazy queues. Lazy lists give you constant time concatenation, which can be useful in itself, but I needed it to implement persistent functional queues.

item.title: Lazy lists
item.description: I wanted to write about lazy lists and lazy queues today, but I spent most of the day struggling with getting lazy evaluation to work.

item.title: Functional lists and queues
item.description: I wanted to write something about function parameters, how these are passed as so-called “promises”, how these have associated scopes (and the consequences of that), and how they give us lazy evaluation.

item.title: Environments and formulae
item.description: In my two previous posts on non-standard evaluation, Scoping rules and NSE and Overscoping and eval, I explained: How R finds the bindings of variables by looking through chains of environments.

item.title: Overscoping and eval
item.description: In my previous post I used the lm function for an example of scope rules, but I left a few details out.

item.title: Scoping Rules and NSE
item.description: Earlier this week, I wrote some tweets about how you have to be careful about scopes when you do “non-standard evaluation”.

item.title: Premarkdown Plugins
item.description: I’m working on a preprocessor for Markdown documents. I write all my books in Markdown, so this is something I have wanted to do for a while, to scratch a few itches I have.

item.title: Software
item.description: I have written various software over the years. You can get a list of most of it at GitHub. Below is a list of software I have worked on recently (and I promise to still be maintaining).
